Plotting module

utils.plot.plot_cms_histogram(bin_edges, data, templates, fitted_pars=None, plot_settings=None, show_signal=True, figsize=(12, 12), ratio_ylim=(0.5, 1.5), xlabel='', ylabel='Events', title='') → Figure[source]

CMS‐style pre/post‐fit plot with an overlay of fit parameters.

utils.plot.plot_params_per_iter(pval_history, aux_history, mle_history, gradients, learning_rates, fname='params_iters.png', plot_settings=None)[source]

Plots p-value/ parameter histories VS # iterations ⌈√N⌉×⌈√N⌉ grid, where N is the total number of parameters (aux + mle) + 1 (pval). Unused subplots are turned off.

Args:

pval_history (Sequence[float]): Sequence of p-values. aux_history (Dict[str, Sequence[float]]): Histories for auxiliary parameters. mle_history (Dict[str, Sequence[float]]): Histories for MLE parameters. fname (str): File name to save the figure to.

utils.plot.plot_pval_history(pval_history, aux_history, mle_history, gradients, learning_rates, fname='pval_history.png', plot_settings=None)[source]

Plots p-value vs parameter histories in an ⌈√N⌉×⌈√N⌉ grid, where N is the total number of parameters (aux + mle). Unused subplots are turned off.

Args:

pval_history (Sequence[float]): Sequence of p-values. aux_history (Dict[str, Sequence[float]]): Histories for auxiliary parameters. mle_history (Dict[str, Sequence[float]]): Histories for MLE parameters. fname (str): File name to save the figure to.

utils.plot.to_numpy(x)[source]

Bring a JAX array or tracer back to host-memory and convert to np.ndarray. Safe to call outside any JAX-transformed function.

utils.plot.to_tex_scientific(x: float, sig: int = 2) → str[source]

Turn a float into a ‘mantissa × 10^{exp}’ LaTeX string. E.g. 2.487e-05 → ‘2.487times10^{-5}’
